intro: Metrosideros costata, commonly known as the coastal rata, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its bright red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in coastal environments and is often found growing on cliffs or rocky shores. Metrosideros costata plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native birds and insects.
